intro: Astracantha polyantha, commonly known as the white star cactus, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its cylindrical stems covered in white, woolly spines. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
